long_description:
It’s the most wonderful time of year – Christmas in July! Mid-summer deals mean special savings for the holiday season. At Stanford Court Hotel, we’re excited to offer a holiday savings special for your winter visit to San Francisco.

Our Stanford Court Holiday Savings Special allows guests to enjoy up to 35 percent off bookings and a waived Urban Bundle Fee. The promotion runs select dates between Nov. 18 through Jan. 6.

Stanford Court Hotel is a boutique hotel situated in the affluent neighborhood of Nob Hill, San Francisco. We recently underwent a huge redesign and have rolled out a brand-new lobby, updated rooms, a state-of-the-art fitness center and exciting amenities – What other hotel in SF has a dedicated music listening room?

Thinking about booking a trip to San Francisco during the holiday season? Check out these annual events that will help to put you in the holiday spirit.

Holiday Tree Lighting and Ice Rink in Union Square

Located just 4 blocks from Stanford Court Hotel, Union Square is known to put on holiday festivities that rival Rockefeller Center. Enjoy holiday music, decorations, lights and ice skating in Union Square. Entry includes skate rental and 90 minutes on the ice. The annual tree lighting ceremony usually takes place over Thanksgiving weekend to kick off the Christmas season. The ice rink is open November through mid-January. 

Illuminate SF

The city-wide “festival of light” lasts year round, but during the longer nighttime hours of the winter season, Illuminate SF rolls out exciting, new works. The holiday light installations kick off on Thanksgiving Day and can be found throughout the city until New Year’s Day. Works range in size from the span of the Bay Bridge to unassuming places, like last year’s Jacob’s Ladder installation at Grace Cathedral in Nob Hill. Refer to Illuminate SF for free, guided light tours, related events and self-guided tours.

SantaCon SF

San Francisco gets amped up for SantaCon SF, where thousands gather in Union Square dressed up as Santa, Ms. Claus, elves and everything in-between. Revelers partake in caroling, games and a costume competition. Toys are collected for children in need of holiday cheer. This year’s SantaCon is set for Dec. 8, so don’t forget to pack your Santa suit! 

Fisherman’s Wharf Lighted Boat Parade

The annual Fisherman’s Wharf Lighted Boat Parade is a SF holiday favorite since its inception in 1994. Gather along the bay to see boats decked to the hulls! The parade route sets off at Pier 39 and heads westward, passing Fisherman’s Wharf, Fort Mason and Crissy Field. The best views include the Aquatic Park, Pier 39, the Marina Green and Crissy Field. If you’re looking to grab some eats while enjoying the parade, stake out your spot at Fisherman’s Wharf.

So, what are you waiting for? The balmy SF weather in November and the season’s excellent holiday festivities will make for an unforgettable trip. Go away for the holidays and enjoy all the holiday cheer of SF. See Stanford Court Holiday Savings Special.
